Container.Name: hypermind
Container.Overview:
The High-Availability Solution to a Problem That Doesn't Exist. Hypermind is a completely decentralized, Peer-to-Peer deployment counter.
It solves the critical infrastructure challenge of knowing exactly how many other people are currently wasting RAM running this specific container, while providing a secure, serverless way to say "hello" to them.
Since the container needs to run as host if you need to change port edit the PORT variable and also the WebUI filed in Advanced View.
Obviously this is a joke, it'll use resources for nothing so only use if you want to participate in the gag. Container's now limited to 2G of RAM by default to avoid unfortunate situations.

Config.Name: Enable chat
Config.Description: Set to true to enable the P2P chat system.

Config.Name: Enable Map
Config.Description: Set to true to enable the map visualization.

Config.Name: Enable Themes
Config.Description: Set to false to disable the theme switcher.

Config.Name: Visual limit
Config.Description: Max number of particles to render on the dashboard.

Config.Name: Max peers
Config.Description: Max peers to track in LRU cache.

Config.Name: Max relay hops
Config.Description: How far a global chat message travels (TTL).

Config.Name: Peer timeout
Config.Description: ms before a silent peer is considered offline.
